trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of connections for a control in a Web Parts zone.
This class cannot be inherited.
A control in a Web Parts zone can act as a consumer of data from another control or as a provider of data to other controls.
This class represents a collection of those connections.

Typically, an instance of this class is returned from a property such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.Connections%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.StaticConnections%2A>.

You can iterate through the collection in the same way you would any collection, and you can search for a particular connection using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection.ID%2A> property.
Adds a member to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnectionCollection"></xref> collection.
Use this method to add a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection> object to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnectionCollection> collection.
The object is added to the end of the collection.
To add an object at a specific location in the collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnectionCollection.Insert%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection"></xref> to be added to the collection.
An integer indicating the index where the connection will be added to the collection.
Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection"></xref> object is in the collection.
Use this method to determine whether a particular connection is contained in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnectionCollection> collection.
This method is commonly used to test for the existence of a connection before performing a task, such as adding a connection to or removing one from a collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection"></xref> to search for.
`true` if the object is in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Copies the elements of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnectionCollection"></xref> collection to an array, starting at a particular array index.
The specified array must be of a compatible type.
The elements are copied to the <xref:System.Array> in the same order in which the enumerator iterates through the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnectionCollection> collection.
The one-dimensional array into which the elements from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnectionCollection"></xref> are copied.
The array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.
array is `null`.
index is less than zero.
Determines the index of the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection"></xref> object in the collection.
Use this method to determine the index of the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection> object in the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection"></xref> to determine the index of.
The zero-based index of the first occurrence of value within the collection, if found; otherwise, -1.
Adds the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection"></xref> object to the collection at the specified index location.
Use this method to insert the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection> object in the collection at the specified index.

As an alternative, you can simply append a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection> object to the end of the collection using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnectionCollection.Add%2A> method.
The zero-based index location at which to insert the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection"></xref> to insert.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnectionCollection"></xref> collection is read-only.
A collection that is read-only does not allow the addition, removal, or modification of elements after the collection is created.
For more information, see <xref:System.Collections.IList.IsReadOnly%2A>.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnectionCollection"></xref> is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection"></xref> object at the specified index.
Use this property to retrieve a particular connection if you know its index in the collection.
You can search for a particular connection using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection.ID%2A> property.
The zero-based index location at which to get the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection"></xref> at the index specified.
Gets a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection"></xref> object with the specified connection ID.
Use this property to retrieve a particular connection if you know the connection ID.
The connection ID of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection"></xref> to be retrieved.
The first occurrence of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection"></xref> with the specified connection ID in the collection.
Removes the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection"></xref> object from the collection.
Use this method to remove the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection> object from the collection.
All items that follow the specified item are then moved up in the collection to fill in the vacant position.
The indexes of the moved items are also updated.
For more information, see <xref:System.Collections.IList.Remove%2A>.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection"></xref> to be removed.
